In a region, there were 10,000 live births in a year. Among them, 15 mothers died due to hemorrhage, 10 due to eclampsia, 5 due to Anemia and 10 due to Road traffic accidents within 42 days of termination of pregnancy. Calculate the Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) for this region due to these specific causes.

A 75 year old woman was diagnosed with Carcinoma breast 2 year ago. Her condition is stable. As a part of Randomised controlled trial you want to put her on a new drug. You noticed that with new drug patient is stable. This new drug prolongs life but doesn’t cure malignancy. If used widely this new drug would

options.label: A
options.text: Increase incidence and decrease prevalence of Carcinoma breast

options.label: B
options.text: Same incidence and decrease prevalence of Carcinoma breast

options.label: C
options.text: Increase incidence and Increase prevalence of Carcinoma breast

options.label: D
options.text: Same incidence and increase prevalence of Carcinoma breast

questions.correct_answer: D. Same incidence and increase prevalence of Carcinoma breast

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of instrument shown?
What does the incubation period of a disease refer to?

options.label: A
options.text: The time between exposure to the pathogen and the onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: The duration of illness after the onset of symptoms

options.label: C
options.text: The period during which the disease is contagious

options.label: D
options.text: The time taken for the pathogen to multiply within the body

questions.correct_answer: A. The time between exposure to the pathogen and the onset of symptoms

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.text: Vaccine is given in only endemic area under Naational Immunisation schedule. It is used to prevent encephalitis in children. What is the schedule of that vaccine?

A: Activate ERS and call for help B: Immediate defibrillation C: Post cardiac arrest care D: High quality cpr E: eA-arly recognition and prevention

The patient had received spinal anaesthesia for LSCS 15 hours back. Multiple attempts at insertion were performed and she now complains of an occipital headache that is worse on standing. What will be the treatment of choice for this condition?
Contraindication to LMA is ?
questions.correct_answer: C. Increased risk of gastric regurgitation

questions.text: Short acting ester local anaesthetic is
Least potent inhalational anaesthetic is

A 20-year-old woman is operated on through a right lower quadrant incision for presumed appendicitis, but the appendix is normal. At this point, which of the following would be an appropriate treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Exploration and appendectomy if no other pathology is found

options.label: B
options.text: Exploration, treatment of any associated pathologic condition, as indicated, and avoiding removal of a healthy appearing appendix

options.label: C
options.text: Midline laparotomy for complete exploration if no pathology can be seen through the right lower quadrant incision

options.label: D
options.text: Exploration and ileal resection if the terminal ileum appears acutely inflamed.

questions.correct_answer: A. Exploration and appendectomy if no other pathology is found

questions.text: During an emergency appendectomy, a surgical resident sustains an injury from a contaminated hollow-bore needle with spontaneous bleeding. Which one of the following blood-borne organisms is most likely to be transmitted, assuming that the patient was infected with all of them?
Based on the standard Milan criteria, which of the following patients with HCC would be eligible for transplantation?

options.label: A
options.text: One 4.5-cm lesion in segment VI with invasion of the right portal vein.

options.label: B
options.text: Three lesions confined to the right lobe, with the largest being 2.5 cm.

options.label: C
options.text: A single, 5.5-cm lesion in segment II.

options.label: D
options.text: Three lesions spread throughout the liver, with the largest being 3.5 cm.

questions.correct_answer: B. Three lesions confined to the right lobe, with the largest being 2.5 cm.

questions.text: What is the preferred treatment for a renal stone in lower pole 25 mm in diameter which gives following image in urine microscopy

options.label: C
options.text: Flexible ureteroscopy with holmium laser lithotripsy

questions.text: A Bochdalek congenital diaphragmatic hernia:

options.label: A
options.text: Is right sided 90% of the time .

options.label: B
options.text: Is located anteriorly at the sternocostal junction

options.label: C
options.text: Usually has a hernia sac with associated abdominal contents

options.label: D
options.text: Is related to failure of development or fusion of the pleuroperitoneal membranes

questions.correct_answer: D. Is related to failure of development or fusion of the pleuroperitoneal membranes

questions.text: A 32-year-old man arrives at the emergency department with an exquisitely painful and “woody” feeling penile erection of 18-h duration. Which of the following is not a therapeutic option?

options.label: A
options.text: Aspiration of blood from the corpora cavernosa

options.label: B
options.text: Irrigation of the corpora cavernosa with papaverine

options.label: C
options.text: Creation of a communication between the glans penis and a corporal body with a biopsy needle or scalpel blade

options.label: D
options.text: Side-to-side anastomosis between the corpus spongiosum and corpus cavernosum

questions.correct_answer: B. Irrigation of the corpora cavernosa with papaverine

questions.text: You are asked to see a 24-year-old male with no medical problems who sustained a gunshot wound to the right thigh 1 h prior to arrival. He is afebrile with an HR of 136 beats/min and a BP of 90/60 mmHg. He is initially alert and asking for water but becomes confused during your brief interview. He is in which class of hemorrhagic shock?

A 63-year-old woman presents to the ED with a 2-day history of left lower quadrant abdominal pain and is found to be febrile to 38.6°C. Her white blood cell (WBC) count is 15,000. On CT scan she is found to have colonic infammation with an associated pericolic abscess. What is her Hinchey stage?

A patient presents with multiple gunshot wounds to the extremity and right lower quadrant. In the operating room, upon entry into the abdomen, a large amount of hemoperitoneum is encountered and all quadrants are packed immediately. Upon reinspection, the patient is noted to have an injury to the infrahepatic vena cava. This can be best expose by following maneuver, what is name of the maneuver
questions.correct_answer: B. Right medial visceral rotation (cattel brasch)

questions.text: An active 75-year-old gentleman presents with a 4-hour history of acute-onset pain and paraesthesia of his right upper limb. He denies any similar symptoms previously but describes a 10-year history of atrial fi brillation, for which he takes digoxin and aspirin. He has no other signifi cant medical history. Examination reveals a cold right hand, absent right radial, ulnar, and brachial pulses, and reduced power and sensation to the right hand and forearm. What is the most appropriate defi nitive management for this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Urgent duplex scanning of the aff ected limb

questions.text: A 56-year-old male presents to his Physician with a 3-week history of sweating, headaches, constipation, and itchy lesions over his back. On examination, his blood pressure is 166/94 mmHg and his pulse rate is 104/min. Twenty-four-hour urinary catecholamines, metanephrines and vanillylmandelic acid are found to be elevated. A CT scan and a 131I-meta-iodo-benzyl-guanidine scan confi rm the presence of a phaeochromocytoma. The patient is subsequently also found to have a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 47-year-old patient presents with as enlarging right parotid mass. You are suspicious for a neoplastic process and perform a fine-needleaspiration(FNA). Whichofthe following is true regarding parotid neoplasms?

options.label: A
options.text: Approximately 75%–80% of parotid gland tumors are malignant.

options.label: B
options.text: The most common parotid tumor is mucoepidermoid carcinoma.

options.label: C
options.text: An open biopsy of a parotid mass is the preferred method of obtaining a diagnosis and providing treatment.

options.label: D
options.text: Warthin’s tumor is the second most common benign salivary gland tumor. Smoking is an etiologic risk factor.

questions.correct_answer: D. Warthin’s tumor is the second most common benign salivary gland tumor. Smoking is an etiologic risk factor.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding direct inguinal hernias?

options.label: A
options.text: Direct hernias are commonly congenital and found in younger patients.

options.label: B
options.text: The risk of incarceration of a direct hernia is high.

options.label: C
options.text: A direct hernia is solely a weakening of the inguinal floor and does not pass through the inguinal rings.

options.label: D
options.text: An indirect hernia may be present as well.

questions.correct_answer: D. An indirect hernia may be present as well.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a sign of tension pneumothorax?
A 68-year-old male presents with symptoms of dysphagia and halitosis. An esophagogram displays outpouching at the cricothyroid on lateral view. Which of the following is true regarding his condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Endoscopic esophago diverticulostomy is best for small, <2 cm, diverticula.

options.label: C
options.text: It is caused by a traction mechanism.

options.label: D
options.text: Diverticulopexy and myotomy are preferred approaches

questions.correct_answer: D. Diverticulopexy and myotomy are preferred approaches

A 27-year-old man with a long-standing history of Crohn’s disease is noted to have several extraintestinal manifestations of Crohn’s disease including erythema nodosum, arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, anemia, and episodes of pancreatitis. During evaluation of his right lower quadrant pain, he is found to have a segment of thickened ileum causing obstruction. Which extraintestinal manifestations of his Crohn’s disease would you not expect to subside after resection of the involved segment of bowel?

A 28-year-old asymptomatic white woman is incidentally found to have a 3.5-cm hypervascular lesion with a central scar in the right lobe of her liver.(shown in figure) On delayed images, there is increased uptake of contrast material in the scar in comparison with the surrounding liver parenchyma. She is otherwise healthy and takes no medications. Liver enzyme and α-fetoprotein levels are within normal limits. Which of the following is the most appropriate management of this patient?
Which one of the following does not form a boundary of Calot’s triangle?

A 47-year-old woman with a history of a left thyroid mass undergoes left thyroid lobectomy. Pathology reveals a 1.3-cm papillary carcinoma with no evidence of extracapsular extension. What is the most appropriate next step in the treatment of this patient?

A 19-year-old man is brought to the Emergency Department after being found unconscious outside a pub. On examination he has a GCS of 3 with a blood pressure of 116/84 mmHg and pulse rate of 94/min. He smells heavily of alcohol. He is noted to have bilateral periorbital haematomas and bruising over the right mastoid process There appears to be serosanguinous discharge from his right nostril and right ear. Otoscopic examination of the right ear reveals blood behind the tympanic membrane. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 28-year-old woman undergoes a wide local excision of a right-sided breast lump along with right axillary clearance. Postoperatively, she complains of numbness in her inner arm and axilla. Which nerve injury has likely caused the patient’s symptoms?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Patients with rest pain are classified as stage III.

options.label: C
options.text: Asymptomatic patients are classified as stage II.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with claudication are classified as stage IV.

questions.correct_answer: B. Patients with rest pain are classified as stage III.
